DataElement.preferredName: Cancer Incidence Rate Geographic Area 100 Character Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text describing the county and state associated with the cancer incidence rate during a specified time period as determined by the patient's primary residence zip code.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._The frequency of new occurrences of an event during a specified time period._Any demarcated area of the Earth; may be determined by both natural and human boundaries.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: The frequency of new occurrences of an event during a specified time period.:All of the continents and every country situated within, the UNITED STATES and each of the constituent states arranged by region, CANADA and each of its provinces, AUSTRALIA and each of its states, the major bodies of water and major islands on both hemispheres, and selected major cities. Although the geographic locations are not printed in INDEX MEDICUS as main headings, in indexing they are significant in epidemiologic studies and historical articles and for locating administrative units in education and the delivery of health care.

Concepts.definition: The frequency of new occurrences of an event during a specified time period.
Any demarcated area of the Earth; may be determined by both natural and human boundaries.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: all components of an address, including building number, street name and type, city, state, postal code, and country.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the county and state as they appear in the incidence box from which the cancer_incidence data is obtained in the https://gis.cancer.gov/canceratlas/app/ website.
